intro: Hilliella alatipes var. macrantha, commonly known as the broad-fruited hilliella, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to South Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
